3. Documentation¶

3.1. Algorithm Classes¶

class stann.bruteNN(pointVector, n)¶

Object for performing nearest neighbor calculations by brute force. The dimension and data type are determined by the dimension and data type of pointVector. Parameter n represents the number of points in pointVector.

DIM¶

Dimension of the vector space.

DATA_TYPE¶

Data type of the points.

ksearch(point, k, ans_vector)¶

Perform a nearest neighbor search on parameter point. Find the k nearest neighbors and store them inside ans_vector.

class stann.sfcnn(pointVector, n)¶

Similar to bruteNN but the nearest neighbor calculations are optimized using a space filling curve algorithm.

DIM¶

Dimension of the vector space.

DATA_TYPE¶

Data type of the points.

ksearch(point, k, ans_vector)¶

Perform a nearest neighbor search on parameter point. Find the k nearest neighbors and store them inside ans_vector.

class stann.sfcnn_knng(pointVector, n)¶

Similar to sfcnn but the nearest neighbor calculations are optimized using multi-threading.

DIM¶

Dimension of the vector space.

DATA_TYPE¶

Data type of the points.

ksearch(point, k, ans_vector)¶

Perform a nearest neighbor search on parameter point. Find the k nearest neighbors and store them inside ans_vector.

class stann.zorderLT¶

Object used to impose a total order on an n-dimensional point cloud. Only for use on point clouds with integral coordinates. Example usage:

import stann

stann.configure(3, stann.DATA_TYPE_INT)
p1 = newRandomPoint(0, 100)
p2 = newRandomPoint(0, 100)

lt = stann.zorderLT()

if(lt(p1, p2))
    print('p1 < p2')

3.2. Utility Functions¶

stann.newRandomPoint(min_val, max_val)¶

Generates a random point with component values between min_val and max_val.

stann.createPointVector()¶

Generates an empty vector of points with dimension and data type matching the module configuration.

stann.createAnswerVector()¶

Generates an empty vector of long integers. Used for storing results of ksearch().

3.3. Point Class¶

Once you have created points with utility functions like newRandomPoint() and createPointVector() there are a number of helper methods you can use to access and manipulate their data.

class stann.Point¶
coords¶

Mutable list that represents the coordinates of the point.

coords_tuple¶

Immutable python tuple that represents the coordinates of the point. Usage:

import stann

stann.configure(3, stann.DATA_TYPE_INT)
p = stann.newRandomPoint(0, 5)
print(p.coords)            # [2, 4, 5]
p.coords[2] = 3
print(p.coords_tuple)      # (2, 4, 3)
